title: The 4 Components of Exercise
content: The 4 components of exercise are stability, strength, Zone 2 aerobic training, and Zone 5 high intensity training.

title: Stability as the Foundation
content: Stability is the cornerstone upon which strength, aerobic performance, and anaerobic performance are delivered. It is a way to transmit force from the body to the outside world in the safest manner possible, across the muscles which are designed to carry that load, as opposed to seeing the dissipation of force across joints that are not fit to do so.

title: Dynamic Neuromuscular Stabilization (DNS)
content: Peter is a big fan of DNS to train proper stabilization and movements. DNS can help with inefficient movement patterns that result in force leakage around the scapula, elbow, knee, back, hips, etc. Stability is probably what Peter thinks of as the foundation upon which everything should be done vis-a-vis exercise.

title: Other Ways to Train Stabilization
content: Other ways to train stabilization include Postural Restoration Institute (PRI) and Pilates. The particular teacher matters a lot, and it's heavily dependent on the practitioner and the student.

title: Insights About Stability Training
content: Peter has shared insights about stability training on his Instagram, including hip hinge (VMO), deadlifts, scapulae, and concentric intra-abdominal pressure (to stabilize the ribs).
